meanings.definition: A device that converts data from one form to another.
meanings.sent1: The encoders in the machine help change the signals.
meanings.sent2: I bought a new set of encoders for my computer.
meanings.sent3: The encoders at the factory were feeling overworked.
meanings.sent4: Her mind worked like a set of encoders, translating thoughts into actions.
meanings.sent5: The encoders hummed softly as they transformed the information.

meanings.definition: A person or thing that encodes information.
meanings.sent1: The encoders in the team were responsible for securing the data.
meanings.sent2: She was known as the best encoder in the office.
meanings.sent3: The encoders at the library always kept things organized.
meanings.sent4: His words acted as encoders, hiding the true meaning behind them.
meanings.sent5: The encoders diligently protected the sensitive information.

meanings.definition: A software program that converts data into a code.
meanings.sent1: The new encoders on the market are very efficient.
meanings.sent2: I need to install an encoder on my computer for security.
meanings.sent3: The encoders on the website kept the information safe.
meanings.sent4: The encoder worked tirelessly, converting the data seamlessly.
meanings.sent5: The encoder swiftly encrypted the message for transmission.
